description.p: This magical shield has an animated face carved into it. It may be unreliable piece of armour, but it certainly an encouraging battle companion. Due to the holes in the face of this shield, it only grants a +1 bonus to AC instead of the normal shield bonus.
Grounding Confidence.While holding Mister Shield you gain a +1 bonus to Wisdom saving throws.

Stalwart Positivity. When an attack roll misses you while holding Mister Shield, you gain Heroic Inspiration. Once triggered, you can't benefit from this property again until you complete a short or long rest.

Sentience. Mister Shield is a sentient, neutral good shield with an Intelligence of 8, a Wisdom of 10, and a charisma of 16. It can see and hear out to a range of 60 ft. The shield can speak, read and understand common. Mister Shield is a jolly and supportive companion who always compliments the bravery of its wielder and cheers when blocking attacks. Mister Shield doesn't like violence, and believes friendship is always the answer.

p.em: "Ha HA! Nice One!" Mister Shield Exclaimed as the demon's flaming flail bounced off its rim. "Even though we're totally surrounded, your defence is unbreakable!"
Jesse yelped as a dagger jabbed her arm, "Shut up! Every time you talk, I get stabbed through your friggin mouth hole!"
With each demon that Jesse defeated, another crawled through the portal to take its place. This was a disaster.

description.p: This armor has 8 charges. As a reaction, whenever you take damage while wearing this armor, you can expend one charge to heal one creature you can see for 1d4 hit points. You can spend more than one charge in this way, healing an additional creature for each additional charge spent.

The armor regains 1d8 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the armor immediately triggers the power of convergence, requiring you to roll on the convergence table

While wearing this armor you gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed, you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatic) checks, and when falling, you glide to an unoccupied space no more than double the distance of the height you fell and take no damage. If there isn’t space to land, you collide with an object in range and take the full fall damage.

The target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be restrained. A creature restrained by the chains can use its action to make another saving throw. On a success, it frees itself. If you expend two charges on the same target, the target makes saving throws against the effect with disadvantage
